title: People Analytics Lead
content:
About the Team
Our People team is a highly collaborative team and each individual proactively contributes to critical initiatives that will change the organization on a local and global scale. We are passionate about helping Mironeers grow their careers at a hyper growth organization! This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who wants to grow their career and change the world together with our super talented team. 
Each role at Miro is based at one of our physical hubs, and we look for talent who wants to be part of these local, highly connected communities. Mironeers work in a hybrid model, with three days a week in-the office as our baseline. 
About the Role
To deliver on our People Team mission, Miro is looking for a People Analytics Lead to serve as our subject matter expert and consult business on everything related to the analysis of employee and workforce data to reveal insights and provide recommendations to improve business success. This requires this role to build and optimize a solid data foundation for high quality data and insights, ethical and compliant processing of data, manager and leader self-serve, agile & compliant tooling, approach to ad hoc data analysis and regular dashboarding. 
You will be a key member of the People Technologies team, reporting into the Head of People Technologies. You will be focused on working with People Team Leadership as well as business to find opportunities to drive decisions efficiently and identify innovative ways to work with data. 
What you’ll do

Develop the foundation for excellence in People Analytics, which means having a strong governance, clear methodologies (processes and frameworks to be established for repeatable and dynamic people analytics) and effective stakeholder management
 Build the right skills (expertise in People Tech as well as the broader People team). Drive data stewardship, data management and how to use data to deliver more value to the business 
Deliver value to Miro, by providing enhanced experiences to the workforce (e.g. measuring the employee experiences, the democratization of data to managers and leaders) , creating impact through business outcomes and developing a data-driven culture for analytics
○ Share information and insights from people data in reports and dashboards regularly in a formal, standardized and repeatable fashion 
○ KPIs & Metrics: Measure the most important metrics 
○ Predictive & Advanced Analytics
 Be a People Analytics Advisor
○  Be a trusted partner with People Partners and business in strategic business discussions and take an active approach to spot opportunities to solve business problems 
○ Frame business questions and build hypothesis, consider statistical 
methodologies for solving problems and collaborate with data scientists to build model and identify insights 
○ Be a storyteller with data; translating analytics into comprehensible insight and actionable recommendations, tailored for each audience 
○ Effectively prioritize the most impactful work 
○ Work on key initiatives and provide recommendations to your main stakeholders 

What you’ll need

6+ years of experience in Analytics or Data Science fields 
4-6 years working in a similar role in a Saas/tech company will be a plus
Experience in building something from scratch in a people analytics area will be a plus 
A proven track record of translating data into business outcomes and helping driving business decisions with data 

What's in it for you

Competitive equity package
Medical insurance coverage
Lunch, snacks and drinks provided in the office
Wellbeing benefit and WFH equipment allowance
Annual learning and development allowance to grow your skills and career
Travel allowance for your commute
Opportunity to work for a globally diverse team
Inspiring workplace in the heart of Amsterdam
About Miro
Miro provides a visual workspace for innovation that enables distributed teams of any size to dream, design, and build the future together. Our mission is to empower teams to create the next big thing by creating a place where teams can create together seamlessly, regardless of location. 
Today, more than 50 million users in 180,000 organizations including Nike, Ikea, Deloitte, WPP, and Cisco depend on Miro to improve product development collaboration, to speed up time to market, and to make sure that new products and services deliver on customer needs.
Miro's visual workspace enables distributed teams to come together to synthesize information, develop strategy, design products and services, and manage processes all throughout the innovation lifecycle. When you look at a Miro Board, you can see hundreds of collaborators moving through the space as named cursors on the screen designing, contributing ideas, providing feedback, and co-creating together with shared tools and information. 
Everyone in Miro has access to the same shared capabilities designed for innovation including diagramming, wireframing, real-time data visualization, and built-in support for agile practices. Miro's workspace is integrated with more than 130 other applications including Jira, Azure DevOps, Asana, Zoom, Slack, and Teams, many of which offer two-way integrations and can be dynamically updated directly from Miro.
Miro enables organizations to accelerate time to market and ensure continuous alignment with customer needs and company strategy. In most organizations, Miro is used by product development teams looking for a new, better way to drive innovation. However, we see more teams including marketing, sales, management consulting, architecture, creative design, and HR that are increasingly applying innovation methodologies such as design thinking and agile practices and adopting Miro for this work.

At Miro, we strive to create and foster an environment of belonging and collaboration across cultural differences. Miro’s mission — Empower teams to create the next big thing — is how we think about our product, people, and culture. We believe that creating big things requires diverse and inclusive teams. Diversity invites all talent with different demography, identities and styles to step in, and inclusion invites them to step closer together. Every day, we are working to build a more diverse Miro, cultivate a sense of belonging for future and current Mironeers around the world, and foster an environment where everyone can collaborate and embrace differences.
